results.title: Repurposing screen identifies Amlodipine as an inducer of PD-L1 degradation and antitumor immunity.

results.title: Amlodipine inhibits proliferation, invasion, and colony formation of breast cancer cells.
results.text_hl: Fortunately, the function of @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ channels can be manipulated pharmacologically using calcium channel blockers (CCBs). @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@, a @CHEMICAL_1_4_dihydropyridine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C038806 @@@dihydropyridine@@@ CCB, has been demonstrated to exert cytotoxic effects in several types of @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancers@@@.

citations.NLM: Alqudah MAY, Al-Samman R, Azaizeh M, Alzoubi KH. Amlodipine inhibits proliferation, invasion, and colony formation of breast cancer cells. Biomed Rep. 2022 Jun;16(6):50. PMID: 35620309

results.title: Involvement of GSK-3beta, NF-kappaB, PPARgamma, and apoptosis in amlodipine's anticancer effect in BALB/c mice.
